props.desc: Contents (icons) of the Quasar icon set

name.desc: Name of the Quasar icon set

heading.desc: Used only when headingX is missing; Icon name following Quasar convention

heading1.desc: (Can be omitted; defaults to 'heading' instead) Icon name following Quasar convention

heading2.desc: (Can be omitted; defaults to 'heading' instead) Icon name following Quasar convention

heading3.desc: (Can be omitted; defaults to 'heading' instead) Icon name following Quasar convention

heading5.desc: (Can be omitted; defaults to 'heading' instead) Icon name following Quasar convention

heading6.desc: (Can be omitted; defaults to 'heading' instead) Icon name following Quasar convention

size.desc: Used only when sizeX is missing; Icon name following Quasar convention

size1.desc: (Can be omitted; defaults to 'size' instead) Icon name following Quasar convention

size2.desc: (Can be omitted; defaults to 'size' instead) Icon name following Quasar convention

size3.desc: (Can be omitted; defaults to 'size' instead) Icon name following Quasar convention

size4.desc: (Can be omitted; defaults to 'size' instead) Icon name following Quasar convention

size5.desc: (Can be omitted; defaults to 'size' instead) Icon name following Quasar convention

size6.desc: (Can be omitted; defaults to 'size' instead) Icon name following Quasar convention

size7.desc: (Can be omitted; defaults to 'size' instead) Icon name following Quasar convention

iconMapFn.desc: Function to map icon names to other icon names; It is designed to be used internally by Quasar only; Only assign a function to it, but do not call it yourself

icon.desc: The mapped icon string, which will be handled by Quasar as if the original icon name was this value; ; Either use only 'icon' or 'cls' + 'content'

cls.desc: CSS classes to apply to the created DOM element; Either use 'cls' + 'content' or only 'icon'

content.desc: Optional, in case you are using a ligature font and you need it as content of the created DOM element; Either use 'cls' + 'content' or only 'icon'

examples: iconName => (myIcons[ iconName ] !== void 0? { icon: myIcons[ iconName ] } : void 0)

iconSet.desc: Usually you will import such an object directly from quasar (eg: import qIconSet from 'quasar/icon-set/<icon-set-name>')

name.desc: Name of the Quasar icon set

heading.desc: Used only when headingX is missing; Icon name following Quasar convention

heading6.desc: (Can be omitted; defaults to 'heading' instead) Icon name following Quasar convention
